newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - June BTPs look to cushion at 129.00.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - June BTPs look to cushion at 129.00.

text.p: June BTPs on LIFFE need to remain above 129.00 to fend off a strong downmove, technical analysts said on Friday.
"We had April peaks in the 129.00 area and there is a little support there," said Susan Rigg, technical analyst at Chart Analysis in London.
The June contract reached highs between 129.02 and 129.05 on April 15, 16, and 17, before making a sustained rise in May.
It was trading at 129.50 at 0759 GMT, five basis points above Thursday's close.
The longer-term outlook is weak, analysts said.
"If the market violates that 129.00 level, we are going to look a lot softer," said Rigg.
The contract has failed to pierce resistance at the January highs, and this is foiling any upmove, analysts said.
June BTPs made a high of 131.70 on January 22 and 131.76 on January 23. The contract hit 131.40 on Wednesday, the top of a rally from 123.60 on March 18, before sliding on Thursday.
"The contract looks very vulnerable," said a technical analyst at Merrill Lynch International in London.
"Unless we get through 131.00, we can go two points to the downside."
June Eurolira futures were at 93.33 at 0815 GMT, two basis points below Thursday's settlement.
Support at 93.30 should hold, said a European bank in a research note.
